turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: They send us to Zammito's house. The FBI is right across the street watching the whole thing, but they don't move. A crime is going down and they don't move. Why?  Because they were waiting for us to come out so they could arrest us.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: What does arresting us get them?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You wanna tell him?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It has to be at Sophie's. She didn't have time to go anywhere else before she came here.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: We don't know that for sure.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: And how do we do that?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: They killed our friend. It's personal now. Besides, if we do that, then Julien died for nothing. The tapes are the key.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: He's right. The tapes give us leverage with Bastaldi.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I wasn't expecting this many of you. I've got a few sleeping bags you can use.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: When do we go?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Tonight.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You ever hear of jet lag?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Take a nap.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: You like shoes?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No, I like the bag. It would be good for the job tonight.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: It belongs to Vincent Bastaldi. He left it last time he was here. I'm sure he wouldn't mind if you used it.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: So, how did you get hooked up with these guys?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Just lucky I guess. How'd you start working for the Bastaldi's?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: The art world doesn't fully appreciate my talent yet. I needed some way to pay the rent. Laurant and Vincent pay well for information.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: So you arranged to have the people you worked for robbed?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: They're not nice people.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Casandra. Old girlfriend?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Did she break your heart?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: It looks old.     Did you get it a long time ago?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You ask a lot of questions.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: That's how you get to know someone.       Did it hurt when you got it?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I don't remember.    I was drunk.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: You got it in a bar?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No. I got it in prison. I went in for three years. When I came out she was married to my best friend. Happy?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Sorry.   I didn't mean to pry.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's okay.   It was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I've been thinking about getting tattoo. You know, a flower or something. On my ass.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Who's gonna see it there?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: The lucky ones.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Can't sleep?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I'm sorry things went so wrong today.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's not your fault.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I thought I'd listen to some of the tapes. See what's so important that a mob guy has to lock it away in his safe.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Sounds boring.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: It's three in the morning.    Not much else to do.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I really thought we had something special going. I can't tell you what a disappointment you've turned out to be.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: After last night I could say the same for you.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Who are you waiting for?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Stick around and find out.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Vincent Bastaldi is in jail.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: Frankie, I --

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: -- Shut up! Don't you try to make me feel bad about this. You knew what would happen to you if you didn't pay. This is on your head, not mine.  Break his arm.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: Jesus, Frankie, I'm your brother!

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: That's why we're only breaking one arm.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: She seems pleasant enough.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: She doesn't know. She thinks I fell down the stairs.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: That's good.    That's what a stand-up guy does.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: So, I just come by to see how you're doin'?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: You broke my arm. How the hell do you think I'm doin'?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah. I mean besides that.    They treating you all right? Food okay?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: Yeah. I'm going home today.    What do you want, Frankie?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: I don't want anything. I just wanted to say... that I may have... overreacted a little the other day.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: A little?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah. I mean, you are my brother and... well I should have found another way of expressing my disappointment. So, I've decided to make it up to you.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: You gonna forget about the money I owe you?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: What are you nuts? A debt is a debt. I was thinking I'd throw a little extra work your way. You know, you come down to the club, make espresso for the boys... wash their cars... run some errands... things like that.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: A car.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Oh really? Thanks. I thought it was a sewing machine. What the hell is it doing here?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: It's for you.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: For me? What am I going to do with a piece of shit like this?

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: I don't know. Sell it. It's gotta be worth something. Someone gave it to me. C'mon Frankie, I'm trying to make good here.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Okay.    Okay.

turns.speaker: VINNY
turns.text: I'll get you the papers tomorrow.

turns.speaker: AUNT WU
turns.text: You're back!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: How's the arm?  Still sore?

turns.speaker: AUNT WU
turns.text: Much better.  You've been gone so long.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Li Mu Bai is coming to stay the night.

turns.speaker: AUNT WU
turns.text: I'll go and make up his room!

turns.speaker: AUNT WU
turns.text: She's crazy.  You should have killed her.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I didn't have the heart.

turns.speaker: AUNT WU
turns.text: Well, Li Mu Bai can do it.

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Wait!  I'm a friend!

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: I don't care about your sword.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Why were you spying on the Yus?

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: I'm looking for someone.  Jade Fox. I'm a police inspector from Shaan Xi, Gen Su district.  Jade Fox is a master criminal.  I hear she infiltrated the Yus.  She must have come with them when they transferred here.  But with Yu's reputation, I can't just go in and accuse her.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: This Jade Fox is a woman?

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BO
turns.text: Then leave her to me.

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: Pardon me, but I doubt you can handle her.  My wife was quite a martial arts expert.  Jade Fox killed her.  So you see, this is personal.  Leave her to me.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Isn't it a bit too late to be out? You've brought me the sword?

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: I do as I please.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Where's your master?

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: What's it to you?

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: Do you think you are a real master?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Like most things, I am nothing. It's the same for this sword.  All of it is simply a state of mind.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: Stop talking like a monk!  Just fight!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Then tell me where Jade Fox is.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: On guard!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Real sharpness comes without effort.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Why should I?  You need practice. I can teach you to fight with the Green Destiny, but first you must learn to hold it in stillness.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: Why do you want to teach me?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I've always wanted a disciple worthy of Wudan's secrets.

turns.speaker: FIGURE
turns.text: And if I use them to kill you?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: That's a risk I'm willing to take. Deep down, you're good.  Even Jade Fox couldn't corrupt you.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Who are you?  Why is the Green Destiny in your possession?

turns.speaker: FIGURE IN BLACK
turns.text: What's it to you?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: My name is Li Mu Bai.  The Green Destiny is mine.  Jade Fox can't be your master.  Where did you learn that "Xuan Piu" move?

turns.speaker: FIGURE IN BLACK
turns.text: I'm just playing around.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Tell me, who is your master?

turns.speaker: FIGURE IN BLACK
turns.text: Let's go!

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: You're home late... or should I say early?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Why are you still here?  You killed a policeman.  You should leave! You'll bring ruin on my whole family.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: They wouldn't have found me if you hadn't stolen the sword.  Like a little girl, you thought stealing would be fun?  You, too, are responsible for that death.  Come with me.  You don't want to waste your life as the wife of some bureaucrat.  Denied your talent... As a master and disciple we will rule.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'll never live as a thief!

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: You're already a thief.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: That was just for fun.  How can I leave?  Where would I go?

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Wherever we want.  We'll get rid of anyone in our way.  Even your father.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: It's the Giang Hu fighter lifestyle... kill or be killed. Exciting, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I owe you nothing.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Yes, you do!  You are still my disciple.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You think you've been teaching me all these years from the manual? You couldn't even decipher the symbols!

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: I studied the diagrams.  But you hid the details!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You wouldn't have understood, even if I had tried to explain.  You know... you've gone as far as you can go.  I hid my skills so as not to hurt you.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: If I hadn't seen you fight with Li Mu Bai, I'd still be ignorant of all you've hidden from me.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Master... I started learning from you in secret when I was 10.  You enchanted me with the world of Giang Hu.  But once I realized I could surpass you, I became so frightened!  Everything fell apart. I had no one to guide me, no one to learn from.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Believe me, I've a lesson or two left to teach you!

turns.speaker: GANGSTER A
turns.text: Hello.  What is your name?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Long.

turns.speaker: GANGSTER A
turns.text: In that case, perhaps we could be of assistance.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Don't bother.

turns.speaker: GANGSTER A
turns.text: You don't seem to understand.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: So what if I don't?

turns.speaker: GANGSTER A
turns.text: Are you related to Li Mu Bai?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: He is my defeated foe!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Please sit.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: I've made you silk pajamas.  Do you want to change into them?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Put them down.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: I heard you met Shu Lien today.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Do you know her?

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: She's one of those.  Your mother would not want you consorting with her kind.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'll socialize with whomever I please.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: Don't invite danger into your father's house.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'm tired now.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: Go to bed then.  Miss has grown up, and is getting married soon.  God knows what the future will bring.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: It will be just the same.  Enough! I'm tired.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: Autumn is coming.  I'll shut the windows for you.

turns.speaker: GOVERNESS
turns.text: This spells trouble.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I have a guest.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: It's heavy for such a thin piece of metal!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: The handle is heavy.  And the blade is no ordinary metal.  Still, the sword is the lightest of weapons. You're just not used to handling it.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: But I have had much practice.  As a child in the West, a platoon lived with us.  They'd let me play with their weapons.  The scabbard is so beautiful.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Beautiful but dangerous.  Once you see it tainted with blood, its beauty is hard to admire.  It's 400 years old.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Exquisite!  You said it belongs to...

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: My friend Li Mu Bai.  He's given it to Sir Te as a gift.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Li Mu Bai!  The famous warrior? Why would he give his sword to Sir Te?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You're too young to understand.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You're a sword fighter too?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Yes, I am.  But I prefer the machete.  Certain moves, however, call for a sword.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: It must be exciting to be a fighter, to be totally free!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Fighters have rules too: friendship, trust, integrity... Without rules, we wouldn't survive for long.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I've read all about people like you. Roaming wild, beating up anyone who gets in your way!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Writers wouldn't sell many books if they told how it really is.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: But you're just like the characters in the stories.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Sure.  No place to bathe for days, sleeping in flea-infested beds... They tell you all about that in those books?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You know what I mean.  I'm getting married soon, but I haven't lived the life I want.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: So I heard.  Congratulations.  It's the most important step in a woman's life, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You're not married, are you?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: No!  You couldn't roam around freely if you were.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You're probably right.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I've missed you.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'm bored.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You're doing calligraphy?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'll write your name.  Just for fun.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You write gracefully.  Calligraphy is so similar to fencing.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Maybe it is.  I wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Thank you for seeing me.  I hear your wedding day is near.  You must be overwhelmed by the preparations.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'm hardly doing a thing.  The less I think of it the better.  My parents are arranging everything. The Gous are a very powerful family. My marrying one will be good for my father's career.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You are fornuate to marry into such a noble family.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Am I?  I wish I were like the heroes in the books I read.  Like you and Li Mu Bai.  I guess I'm happy to be marrying.  But to be free to live my own life, to choose whom I love... That is true happiness.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Do you think so?  Let me tell you a story.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: About you and Li Mu Bai?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Yes.  Did you know I was once engaged to be married?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: No, really?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: His name was Meng Si Zhao.  He was a brother to Li Mu Bai by oath. One day, while in battle, he was killed by the sword of Li Mu Bai's enemy.  After, Li Mu Bai and I went through a lot together.  Our feelings for each other grew stronger.  But how could we dishonor Meng's memory?  So the freedom you talk about, I too desire it.  But I have never tasted it.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Too bad for Meng, but it's not your fault, or Li Mu Bai's.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I am not an aristocrat, as you are... but I must still respect a woman's duties.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Don't distance us.  From now on, let's be like sisters.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Then as a sister, let me wish you happiness in your marriage.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You say she killed a policeman?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Yes, from the West.  He went undercover and and followed her here,

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Here you must be in proper attire.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I'm just borrowing some clean clothes.  I'm not staying.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I'll give them to you.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: I was just passing by and wondered how you were.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You, sister...

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Look at the trouble you've caused. Now you know what Giang Hu life is really like.  If you think of me as your sister, let me give you some sisterly advice.  You can run from marriage, but not your parents.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: They forced me to marry!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Go back to them first.  Then you can decide about Lo.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You know about Lo?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: He really loves you.  Come back to Peking with me.  We'll find a solution.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Where is he now?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Li Mu Bai has made arrangements. He sent him to Wudan Mountain.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You're working together to set me up!  I'm leaving!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: How dare you accuse us?  I always knew you had stolen the sword! I've done nothing but protect you and your family.  And you're repaid me with nothing but contempt.  Li Mu Bai himself spared you, and all you do is insult him.  We wanted some peace and you've ruined it all! You're no sister of mine!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: What do I care?  You were never a real friend anyway.  But I wonder, how long could you last as my enemy?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Don't touch it!  That's Li Mu Bai's sword.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Come and get it if you can.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Without the Green Destiny, you are nothing.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Don't be a sore loser.  Go ahead. Take your pick.  I'll wait.  Go ahead.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You can't die!  Tell us what poison you used!  You can't die!  Tell us the antidote!  You can't let Li Mu Bai die!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: She used Purple Yin... Purple Yin poison.  It goes straight to the heart.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Take my horse and go to the compound. Give this to Mrs. Wu.  She'll help you.  Hurry!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Spare your energy.  I'll be back!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Stop it!  You don't deserve the Green Destiny.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Not another lecture!  On guard!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Let's end this here.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Only the sword will settle this.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: What I've always wanted, to teach you.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: All right.  If you can take back the sword in three moves, I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Give it back!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Kneel!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Never!

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Then you have no use for the sword.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: The antidote exists.  She taught it to me.  The formula is simple, but it takes time to prepare.  Trust me. As you have helped me, let me help you.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: All right.  Hurry.  I will hold on as long as I can.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Lo?

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Jen!

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You shouldn't have come.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: With all the traffic on your rooftop these days... it took me a while to get in here.  I can't wait any longer.  I was wrong to let you go.  Come back with me.  You'll be happy in the desert.  You'll be free there.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Let's stop a moment.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Give it back!

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: You're tired.  You need rest.  Your horse needs water.  There's a creek up here.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Well, there used to be!  What's your name?  I'm Lo.  The Hans call me Dark Cloud.  I'm not that tall or big, but I'm quick as lightning.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: My comb!

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: You've got quite a temper.  It's better this way.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: You coward!

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Still in a bad mood?  At least you're speaking.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: No more hitting on the head!  All this trouble for a comb?

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: It's mine.  It means a lot to me. A barbarian like you wouldn't understand.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Not true.  I can use it to pick fleas from my horse.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: By the way, I'm a real Manchurian.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: I'm sorry... I guessed wrong.  I though you were a Han.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Give me back my comb.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: I don't take orders from anyone.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Give it back.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: When I was a boy, one night, I saw a thousand shooting stars.  I thought, where did they all go? I'm an orphan.  I used to look for stars alone.  I thought if I rode to the other end of the desert, I'd find them.  I've been riding in the desert ever since.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: And so, the little boy became a fearsome bandit.  He couldn't find the stars, so he stole my comb.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Out here, you always fight for survival.  You have to be part of a gang to stand a chance.  Slowly, your gang becomes your family.  All that Dark Cloud stuff is just to scare people and make my life easier.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: So you're still that little boy looking for shooting stars.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: I am a man.  And now I've found the brightest star of all.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Your father's men are still looking for you.  They're still out there, circling closer.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Let them look.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: It is trouble for me.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Don't send me back!

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: You must decide.  You might get tired of this life.  You might begin to miss your family.  If it were our daughter, we'd look for her too.  She would miss us.  Jen... I want you to be mine forever.  I will make my mark on the world.  I will earn your parents' respect. We have a legend.  Anyone who dares to jump from the mountain, God will grant his wish.  Long ago, a young man's parents were ill, so he jumped.  He didn't die.  He wasn't even hurt.  He floated away, far away, never to return.  He knew his wish had come true.  If you believe, it will happen.  The elders say, "A faithful heart makes wishes come true."

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Keep it safe.  Return it to me when we are together again.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: If you don't, I'll come after you. And I won't let you off so easy.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: Jen...

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Don't ever come back.

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Do you remember the legend of the young man?

turns.speaker: LO
turns.text: "A faithful heart makes wishes come true."

turns.speaker: JEN
turns.text: Make a wish, Lo.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Mu Bai...It's been too long.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: It has.  How's business?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Good.  And how are you?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Monk Zheng said you were at Wudan Mountain.  He said you were practicing deep meditation.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: The mountain must be so peaceful... I envy you.  My work keeps me so busy, I hardly get any rest.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I left the training early.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Why?  You're a Wudan fighter. Training is everything.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: During my meditation training... I came to a place of deep silence... I was surrounded by light... Time and space disappeared.  I had come to a place my master had never told me about.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You were enlightened?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: No.  I didn't feel the bliss of enlightenment.  Instead... I was surrounded by an endless sorrow.  I couldn't bear it.  I broke off my meditation.  I couldn't go on. There was something... pulling me back.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Something I can't let go of.  You are leaving soon?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: We're preparing a convoy for a delivery to Peking.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Perhaps I could ask you to deliver something to Sir Te for me.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: The Green Destiny Sword?  You're giving it to Sir Te?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I am.  He has always been our greatest protector.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I don't understand.  How can you part with it?  It has always been with you.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Too many men have died at its edge. It only looks pure because blood washes so easily from its blade.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You use it justly, you're worthy of it.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: It's time for me to leave it behind.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: So what will you do now?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Come with me to Peking.  You can give the sword to Sir Te yourself. It'll be just like old times.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: First I must visit my master's grave.  It's been many years since Jade Fox murdered him.  I have yet to avenge his death.  And yet I'm thinking of quitting.  I must pray for his forgiveness.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Join me once you have finished.  I can wait for you in Peking.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Sir Te believes it's a ploy cast suspicion on Governor Yu.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: But something is going on at the Yu household.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: What have you discovered?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Jade Fox?  Impossible.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You always suspected she'd fled to the West.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I didn't think she'd dare come back to Peking!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Is there any place safer than under the nose of Governor Yu?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: So I shall avenge my master's death after all.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Be careful.  Sir Te requires discretion.  Official business is difficult enough.  Don't let personal feelings make it worse. And I don't know... even this poster... could be some sort of trap.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Did you see who posted it?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: It says Jade Fox is hiding at Yu's. On the night of the theft there was a brawl near Yu's.  Were you involved?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: It was Bo, Sir Te's man.  I hear he followed the thief to the Yus'.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Have you questioned him yet?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: No, not yet...

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: But your men are watching over Yu's compund?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: No, I'd already sent them home. You can blame me for losing the sword, but please trust that I'll get it back soon using my own methods.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: That's not what I meant.  I don't care about the sword.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: What do you mean?  Didn't you come back here for it?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I don't know it was stolen until I got here.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Then, why did you come?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Well, we had talked...

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I admit, getting it back makes me realize how much I'd missed it.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: But it's not your sword anymore. You gave it to Sir Te.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: True.  But I must borrow it for one last mission.  Jade Fox must die at its edge.  Did you know what you were hiding when you covered for that girl?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: My job was to get the sword back, without embarassing anyone.  I wasn't about to ruin her life, or her father's.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: You did your job well.  But, this girl... I saw her last night.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I knew she would intrigue you.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: She needs direction... and training.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: She's an aristocrat's daughter. She's not one of us.  In any case, it will all be over soon.  You'll kill Fox, and she'll marry.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: That's not for her.  She should come to Wudan and become a disciple.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: But Wudan does not accept women.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: For her, they might make an exception.  If not, I'm afraid she'll become a poisoned dragon.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: It's not our affair.  Even if Wudan accepts her, her husband might object.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I thought by giving away the sword, I could escape the Giang Hu world. But the cycle of bloodshed continues.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I wish there were something more I could do to help you.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Just be patient with me, Shu Lien.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You think Jade Fox will show up?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: She's out there, but I doubt she'll show herself.  We'll keep our eyes open.  Sooner or later, she'll come for the girl.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Don't you want to see her again.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: All right.  I'll write you an introduction.  Take it to Wudan. Wait there for news from me.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Shu Lien... The things we touch have no permanence.  My master would say... there is nothing we can hold on to in this world.  Only by letting go can we truly possess what is real.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Not everything is an illusion.  My hand... wasn't that real?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Your hand, rough and callused from machete practice... All this time, I've never had the courage to touch it.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Giang Hu is a world of tigers and dragons, full of corruption... I tried sincerely to give it up but I have brought us only trouble.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: To repress one's feelings only makes them stronger.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: You're right, but I don't know what to do.  I want to be with you... just like this.  It gives me a sense of peace.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: We're close to your headquarters. Go home and check in.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I'll look around and catch up later.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Not a bad idea.  Tonight we'll get a good night's sleep at headquarters.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Jade Fox drugged her.  How did you get here?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: We followed Jade Fox.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: My blood will soon reverse its flow. It's the same poison she used to kill my master.  There is no antidote.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: That can't be!  Everything has an antithesis!  Why not this?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Mu Bai, hold on.  Give me some hope...

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: Shu Lien...

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Save your strength.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: My life is departing.  I've only one breath left.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Use it to meditate.  Free yourself from this world as you have been taught.  Let your soul rise to eternity with your last breath.  Do not waste it... for me.

turns.speaker: LI
turns.text: I've already wasted my whole life. I want to tell you with my last breath... I have always loved you. I would rather be a ghost, drifting by your side... as a condemned soul... than enter heaven without you.  Because of your love... I will never be a lonely spirit.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: Madam Te is certainly spoiling us with these wedding gifts.  She's being so considerate.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I'm sorry she's not feeling well enough to receive you today.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: I heard Sir Te lost something.  And now Madame Te's not feeling well...

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: We know who stole the missing item. If the thief returns it, I'm sure Sir Te will pursue the matter no further.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: That's good.  Sometimes the help can't keep their hands to themselves. It's very embarassing.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Sir Te knows that even well-meaning people can make mistakes... that can bring ruin to themselves and their families.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: But don't be too lenient.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: No mercy will be shown toward the murderer who turned up in Peking.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: A murderer?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Yes.  The very killer of Li Mu Bai's own master.  Last night, she killed a policeman who had tracked her down.

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: A female criminal!  Now that's news!

turns.speaker: MADAM YU
turns.text: Maybe the murderer and the thief are one and the same.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I doubt it.  This thief... it very unusual...

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: It's Jade Fox!

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: We must avenge mother!

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: You're mistaken.  We're just street performers.  We were rehearsing.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Father!

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: They're gone.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: "We'll settle this at midnight on Yellow Hill."  Good, the fox is out of her hole.

turns.speaker: TSAI
turns.text: If you surrender now, you'll suffer less.  But if you resist, I won't stop until you're dead.

turns.speaker: MAY
turns.text: Father!  Let me avenge my mother's death.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: This is Li's personal sword, a great hero's weapon!  He is the only one in the world worthy of carrying it.  It's too fine a gift. I cannot accept it.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Sir Te!  It has brought him as much trouble as glory.  Help him to leave these troubles behind. Otherwise, he'll never be able to start anew.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: All right.  I'll act as the sword's custodian.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: You've always been so good to Li Mu Bai and me.  Please accept our thanks.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: Please do not be such a stranger. You'll stay the night as my guest. Now, Shu Lien... tell me something. And forgive me for prying.  Your father was a great friend to me, and I think of you as my own daughter.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Please, Sir Te, what is it?

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: Li Mu Bai giving up his sword and his warrior days... maybe he's trying to tell you something?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: Don't be coy.  I've always known about your feelings for each other. All these years, it's a shame... neither of you is brave enough to admit the truth to the other. You're both wasting precious time.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: I beg your pardon.  Li Mu Bai and I aren't cowards.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: When it comes to emotions, even great heroes can be idiots.  Tell me if Li Mu Bai is not more open the next time you see him.  I'll give him an earful!

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Has Governor Yu ever seen the sword?

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: Yes, though I doubt he's involved in this.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: But the sword could be in his compound.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: Then someone's trying to set him up. We should inform Li Mu Bai.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: We must be careful.  Governor Yu is a court official, and in charge of security.  Any disturbance will cast suspicion on him.  It might get Sir Te in trouble.

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: This is a delicate matter.

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: Sir Te, can you find some excuse to invite Madam Yu and her daughter?

turns.speaker: SIR TE
turns.text: What do you have in mind?

turns.speaker: YU
turns.text: The best way to trap a fox is through her cubs.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Sure it coulda.  Funboy's not here, neither is T-Bird -- none of Top Dollar's number ones.

turns.speaker: TORRES
turns.text: You know, you sure got a hard-on for a guy that's guilty of zip on paper.  Top Dollar runs Showtime; what's the matter, don't you like adult entertainment?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: This sack of shit is called Tin- Tin.

turns.speaker: TORRES
turns.text: Don't any of your little pals have real, grown up names?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: He was a runner for Top Dollar. Just muscle.

turns.speaker: TORRES
turns.text: Was. ALBRECHT  This isn't Top Dollar's style anyway.  This was somebody else. Somebody new.

turns.speaker: TORRES
turns.text: And you're gonna tell me who.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Who ever made that.

turns.speaker: TORRES
turns.text: What in the hell... do you call that?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I call it blood, Detective.  If you want, you can call it graffiti.

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: Talent. Hi.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Care for a hot dog?

turns.speaker: ELLY
turns.text: You buying?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'm buying.
